climbs.name: Gumbies Go Home
climbs.fa: Shane Cobourn, Doug Reed, Sean Cobourn  1985?

content.description: This is the big roof right of the Fortress.  In center of roof is a "hole".  Climb the right arching feature to right of the hole.  Reach left, grab the hole, and pull the roof.  Bonus style points if you put feet in hole and get an inverted rest!
content.protection: Bolt in the hole.  TR anchors on top.  Some small gear too.

content.description: Same start as Finger Crack then traverse left along the obvious, smaller finger crack and continue climbing up on the face of the Fortress. Using the big hole and trending cliff right on the subtly featured face is harder territory, otherwise climb cliff left toward the bigger features.
content.protection:
Trad Gear- It will take small to medium gear.

Anchor- Two bolts, use longer anchor material. Walk off.

content.description:
Straddle the arete and climb the micro ledges on the face of the fortress. Finish out on Fortress Fingers to the top.  Keep off Finger Crack (5.8) trad for the full effect of this training route.

This is a TOP ROPE variation. Training Route.

Climb on the overhung cliff right arete of Fortress Wall. Seriously, climb the arete and only the arete. I pity the fool who climbs into Finger Crack(5.8).

Honestly, this is just a fun variation(eliminate)on a high traffic wall with an easy access top-rope set up. So why not have a little fun right?
content.protection:
Trad gear if leading

Top Rope set up with a directional if you don't want to take a super big swing.

Use Finger Crack (5.8) anchor.
content.location: Last route cliff right on Fortress Wall before turning the corner to Gumby's Roof.

content.description:
Fun easy lead climbing the arete cliff left of Big Crack(5.5)

Straddle the arete and make your way to the top... nuff said.
content.protection:
Trad rack

Anchor bolts with no rings (same as Big Crack(5.5) but sling your anchor on the opposite side of Big Crack.)

content.description: Starts on some juggy holds, leads to a right-veering crack which leads to some more big holds to the top.  Fun route with some moves that require a bit of problem-solving.
content.protection: Top-rope from anchors.  Small and medium gear if leading.  Bolts for anchors.
content.location: This route shares a start with Fortress Fingers, but uses the crack and larger holds rather than the face.  Once past the crack at the bottom, it's pretty direct to the top.

climbs.name: Eye Sockets
climbs.fa: Shane Cobourn, Doug Reed, Sean Cobourn

content.description: Climb straight up directly under the two bolts. Casual climbing after pulling the roof.
content.protection: North Carolina Trad Rack. Bolted Anchor (bring long Cordelette/webbing/slings and carpet patch/blanket for your rope to lay on if you plan to top-rope).
content.location:
Center of GUMBIES ROOF.

Right of 'Aerial Act'.

Left of 'Gumbies Go Home'.

content.description:
This route is mostly a Top Rope route.

I tried to lead 'Direct' on 09/17/2011 and I had to trend closer to 'Big Crack' due to lack of protection on the face after the first two horizontal cracks.

I feel like this lead should be considered an 'X' or an 'R' due to the lack of protection above the second horizontal (unless you stay closer to 'Big Crack' which would then no longer be 'Direct').

I've since found out that this route was probably 'Head Pointed' (rehearsed on TOP ROPE until dialed/memorized) then sent on lead. This tactic is often employed on routes with repercussions such as a ground fall.

Either way, try it on Top Rope and see if you can stay 'Direct'.
content.protection:
North Carolina Trad Rack. Small to large gear if leading. The face gets blank after the second horizontal crack.

Mostly Top Roped. Bring longer slings/webbing/cordelette for the two bolt anchor shared with 'Fortress Fingers' and 'Finger Crack'.
content.location:
The blank face to the right of 'Big Crack'.

Left of 'Finger Crack'.

content.description: Big Crack...hard to give a better description.  The rock is solid, but sharp.  Use caution when setting up a top-rope.
content.protection: Top-Rope.  Large gear if leading.  Bolts serve as anchors.
content.location: Big Crack is...well, the big crack.  It's the left-most climb on The Fortress.  Walk-off or rap the route.

content.description: Beneath big roof right of Fortress.  Route ascends the left side of the roof.
content.protection: no fixed gear except anchors on summit shared with Gumbies.
content.location: Big roof right of Fortress.  Walk off.
